bitfield.description: Module ID Field
RTL Revision
Major Revision
Minor Revision
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Warm reset. Setting this bit to 1 triggers a module warm reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During read, it always returns 0. The warm reset keeps the configuration registers unchanged
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Software reset. Setting this bit to 1 triggers a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During read, it always returns 0

Reset status of VP[3:0] pixel clock domain

Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region

MFLAG_START for DMA master port
MFLAG_CTRL for DMA master port
Global GO Command for the VP[3:0] output. It is used to synchronize the pipelines associated with the VP output. wr: immediate
Global VP[3:0] Enable
Controls if the DMA buffers are re-filled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all DMA buffers are re-filled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold
Enable Shared DMA Buffer feature
WB DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines, if WB pipeline is present
VIDL2 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines, if VIDL2 is present
VID2 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines, if VID2 is present
VIDL1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines
VID1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines
IP Internal - Tie-off value on DMA_BACKLOGSTATUS pins when DMA Backlog Status reporting is disabled
IP Internal - Disable generation of DMA Backlog Status reporting to interconnect

The value sent out on the PRI_HI bus from DSS to CBA Indicates the priority level for high-priority [MFLAG] transactions. Value of 0x0 indicates highest priority Value of 0x7 indicates lowest priority
The value sent out on the PRI_LO bus from DSS to CBA Indicates the priority level for normal [non-MFLAG] transactions. Value of 0x0 indicates highest priority Value of 0x7 indicates lowest priority

Enable debug ports

Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to WB THREAD4.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n. Default:0KB
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP3 THREAD3.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n. Default:0KB
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP2 THREAD2.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n. Default:0KB
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP1 THREAD1.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n. Default:0KB
Total DMA buffer size for all the pipelines connected to VP0 THREAD0.If the value programmed is n, then the allocated buffer size is 16KB*n. Default:256KB
